titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-60, by Mr. Putnam.

The requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House is waived with respect to any resolution reported on the legislative day of April 28, 2005 providing for consideration or disposition of a conference report accompanying H. Con. Res. 95.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 31.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 242.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 199 (Roll no. 146).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/28/2005--Passed House without amendment. Waives a specified requirement of rule XIII to: (1) provide for consideration or disposition of the conference report on H.Con.Res. 95 (establishing the congressional budget for FY 2006); or (2) establish a separate order relating to budget enforcement.
